io.orchestrate.client

Class RelationResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.orchestrate.client.RelationResource

  • public class RelationResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The resource for the relation features in the Orchestrate API.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected OrchestrateClient client
      The Orchestrate client to make requests with.
      protected JacksonMapper jacksonMapper 
      protected com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper
      The object mapper used to deserialize JSON responses.

        public RelationResource ifAbsent(boolean ifAbsent)
        Whether to store the object if no such relation already exists.
        Parameters:
        ifAbsent - If true
        Returns:
        This RelationResource.

      • ifMatch

        public RelationResource ifMatch(@NonNull
                                java.lang.String objectRef)
        The last known version of the stored object to match for the request to succeed.
        Parameters:
        objectRef - The last known version of the stored object.
        Returns:
        This RelationResource.

      • get

        public OrchestrateRequest<Relation> get(java.lang.String kind,
                                        java.lang.String destCollection,
                                        java.lang.String destKey)
        Retrieve a Relation object.

        Usage:

         
 Relation relation =
         client.relation("someCollection", "someKey")
               .get("someKind", "otherCollection", "otherKey")
               .get();
        Parameters:
        kind - String The name of the relationship.
        destCollection - String The name of destination collection.
        destKey - String The name of destination key.
        Returns:
        A prepared get request.

      • get

        public <T> OrchestrateRequest<RelationList<T>> get(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                   java.lang.String... kinds)
        Fetch objects related to a key in the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         
 RelationList<String> relatedObjects =
         client.relation("someCollection", "someKey")
               .get(String.class, "someKind")
               .get();
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to deserialize the response from the request to.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Type information for deserializing to type T at runtime.
        kinds - The name of the relationships to traverse to the related objects.
        Returns:
        A prepared get request.

      • put

        public OrchestrateRequest<java.lang.Boolean> put(java.lang.String kind)
        Store a relationship between two objects in the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         
 boolean result =
         client.relation("someCollection", "someKey")
               .to("anotherCollection", "anotherKey")
               .put(kind)
               .get();
        Parameters:
        kind - The name of the relationship to create.
        Returns:
        A prepared put request.

      • put

        public OrchestrateRequest<RelationMetadata> put(java.lang.String kind,
                                                com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode properties)
        Store a relationship, with an associated JSON property object, between two objects in the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         
 JsonNode properties = new ObjectMapper().readTree("{ \"foo\" : \"bar\" }");
 RelationMetadata result =
         client.relation("someCollection", "someKey")
               .to("anotherCollection", "anotherKey")
               .put(kind, properties)
               .get();
        Parameters:
        kind - The name of the relationship to create.
        properties - A json object representing the properties of this relationship.
        Returns:
        A prepared create request.

      • purge

        public OrchestrateRequest<java.lang.Boolean> purge(java.lang.String kind)
        Remove a relationship between two objects in the Orchestrate service. 
         
 boolean result =
         client.relation("someCollection", "someKey")
               .to("anotherCollection", "anotherKey")
               .purge(kind)
               .get();
        Parameters:
        kind - The name of the relationship to delete.
        Returns:
        A prepared delete request.

      • to

        public RelationResource to(java.lang.String collection,
                           java.lang.String key)
        The "destination" object to point the relationship to.
        Parameters:
        collection - The collection containing the destination key.
        key - The destination key to add the relation to.
        Returns:
        This relation resource.

      • invert

        public RelationResource invert()
        Swap the "source" and "destination" in the request, equivalent to: 
         
 this.invert(Boolean.TRUE);
        Returns:
        This relation resource.
        See Also:
        invert(boolean)

      • invert

        public RelationResource invert(boolean invert)
        If invert is true the "source" and "destination" objects will be swapped in the request. This is useful for designing a bi-directional relationship.
        Parameters:
        invert - Whether to invert the request.
        Returns:
        This relation resource.

      • limit

        public RelationResource limit(int limit)
        The number of relation results to get in this query, this value cannot exceed 100. This property is ignored in #put(...) and #purge(...) requests.
        Parameters:
        limit - The number of search results in this query.
        Returns:
        This request.

      • offset

        public RelationResource offset(int offset)
        The position in the results list to start retrieving results from, this is useful for paginating results. This property is ignored in #put(...) and #purge(...) requests.
        Parameters:
        offset - The position to start retrieving results from.
        Returns:
        This request.
